dublinCore.title: 113 S563 IS: Jumpstart GSE Reform Act
dublinCore.rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Corker(for himself,Mr. Warner,Mr. Vitter, andMs. Warren) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to theCommittee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

form.official-title: To provide certainty that Congress and the Administration will undertake substantive and structural housing finance reform, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Jumpstart GSE Reform Act .
As used in this Act, the following definitions shall apply:

paragraph.text: The termenterprisehas the same meaning as insection 1303 of the Federal Housing Enterprises Financial Safety and Soundness Act of 1992.
The termguarantee feehas the same meaning as in section 1327(a) of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1992(12 U.S.C. 4547(a)).
The termSecretarymeans the Secretary of the Treasury.
The termSenior Preferred Stock Purchase Agreementmeans—

subparagraph.text: the Amended and Restated Senior Preferred Stock Purchase Agreement, dated September 26, 2008, as such Agreement has been amended on May 6, 2009, December 24, 2009, and August 17, 2012, respectively, and as such Agreement may be further amended and restated, entered into between theDepartment of the Treasuryand each enterprise, as applicable; and

any provision of any certificate in connection with such Agreement creating or designating the terms, powers, preferences, privileges, limitations, or any other conditions of the Variable Liquidation Preference Senior Preferred Stock of an enterprise issued or sold pursuant to such Agreement.

section.header: Prohibition on use of guarantee fees to offset other government spending
section.text: An increase in the guarantee fee required to be charged by an enterprise may not be used to offset an increase in outlays or a reduction in revenues for any purpose other than those related to the enterprises' business functions under—

paragraph.text: theBalanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985; or

section.header: Limitations on sale of preferred stock
section.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law or any provision of the Senior Preferred Stock Purchase Agreement, theSecretarymay not sell, transfer, relinquish, liquidate, divest, or otherwise dispose of any outstanding shares of senior preferred stock acquired pursuant to the Senior Preferred Stock Purchase Agreement, until such time asCongresshas passed and thePresidenthas signed into law legislation that includes a specific instruction to theSecretaryregarding the sale, transfer, relinquishment, liquidation, divestiture, or other disposition of the senior preferred stock so acquired.
